newsitem.title: GERMANY: German DAX ends steady, shrugs off German data.
newsitem.headline: German DAX ends steady, shrugs off German data.

text.p: German shares ended bourse trade on Thursday little changed, shrugging off a small rise in German jobless data for August and GDP data amid limited buying interest before Friday's U.S. jobless figures.
The 30-share blue-chip DAX index closed down 2.85 points at 2,529.54 after a rangebound session. The Bundesbank's decision to leave its key rates unchanged, as expected, failed to move the market.
"I'm afraid we're waiting for the U.S. data again," said one dealer. The jobless data is due at 1230 GMT Friday.
Dealers said news of a 14,000 rise in German unemployment in August compared to the month before had been largely expected.
"A particularly good unemployment figure could have influenced the debt market (and then indirectly share trading) but these figures were already largely discounted," another trader said.
Corporate news was thin. Diversified industrial group Preussag AG dropped 2.50 marks to 347.50 marks after Deutsche Morgan Grenfell downgraded its stock to "underweight" from "neutral".
The company had reported a fall in sales for the first nine months of the year.
